sentences.en: A boy grows into a man.
sentences.cn: 男孩长成了男人

sentences.en: A feeling of distrust grew on me.
sentences.cn: 我逐渐产生一种不信任感

sentences.en: a taste that grows on a person.
sentences.cn: 使人逐渐喜爱的口味

sentences.en: a tree which will grow well in most types of soil
sentences.cn: 在大部分土壤里都能生长得很好的一种树

sentences.en: Absurdly, it makes shoppers overpay farmers to grow too much food.
sentences.cn: 荒谬的是，这样会使得购物者支付过多的钱让农民去种太多的粮食。

sentences.en: Air travel will continue to grow at about 6% per year.
sentences.cn: 乘飞机旅行的人数将以每年大约6%的速度持续增加。

sentences.en: an article that grew out of a few scribbled notes; trust that grew out of long acquaintance.
sentences.cn: 由潦草的记录而形成的文章；由长期相识而产生的信任

sentences.en: Britain grows 6,000,000 tonnes of potatoes a year.
sentences.cn: 英国一年种植600万吨马铃薯。

sentences.en: Colette's old perm had almost grown out.
sentences.cn: 科莱特烫过的头发都快长直了。

sentences.en: Company executives say revamped merchandising should help Macy's earnings to grow.
sentences.cn: 公司主管说销售规划改进后应该能够帮助梅西公司提高收益。

sentences.en: Developed land was to grow from 5.3% to 6.9%.
sentences.cn: 已开发土地的面积将从5.3%增加到6.9%。

sentences.en: Everything that could grow was running wild for lack of attention.
sentences.cn: 凡是能长的都因为缺乏照管而疯长一气。

sentences.en: Feed plants and they grow, neglect them and they suffer.
sentences.cn: 人勤地生宝；人懒地长草。

sentences.en: He predicted that my hair would grow back "in no time"
sentences.cn: 他预言我的头发“一眨眼”就会长回来。

sentences.en: In its natural habitat, the hibiscus will grow up to 25ft.
sentences.cn: 在原生境中，木槿能长到25英尺高。

sentences.en: It's a bit big, but she'll soon grow into it.
sentences.cn: 这件衣服稍大了点，但是过不了多久她就会长到可以穿了。

sentences.en: Many families own plots of land to grow food.
sentences.cn: 许多人家都有自己的小块土地种植粮食。

sentences.en: Nothing would grow in the shadow of the grey wall.
sentences.cn: 灰墙的背阴处什么东西也长不出来。

sentences.en: She grew into her job. He grew into the relationship slowly.
sentences.cn: 她逐渐适应了工作。他慢慢地适应了这种关系

sentences.en: Slowly and strangely, the place began to grow on me.
sentences.cn: 真是不可思议，我渐渐地喜欢上这个地方了。

sentences.en: sponsorship money doesn't grow on trees in the States.
sentences.cn: 在美国赞助款不是唾手可得的。

sentences.en: Support for Mr Thompson is growing.
sentences.cn: 汤普森先生的支持率在上升。

sentences.en: The caterpillars tunnel into the fruit to grow and mature.
sentences.cn: 毛虫钻入果实，并在其中生长为成虫。

sentences.en: The growing season is from April to September.
sentences.cn: 4月到9月是种植季节。

sentences.en: The mother provides the embryo with nourishment and a place to grow.
sentences.cn: 母亲为胎儿提供营养和成长的空间。

sentences.en: The plants grow wild (= grow without anyone looking after them ) by the river.
sentences.cn: 这些植物在河边自然生长。

sentences.en: This political row threatens to grow into a full blown crisis.
sentences.cn: 这场政治争端有可能演化成一场全面爆发的危机。

sentences.en: this stuff grows on you.
sentences.cn: 这种东西会越来越吸引你。

sentences.en: Victor seemed to grow taller every day.
sentences.cn: 维克托好像一天比一天高。

sentences.en: We tried to grow some copper sulphate crystals with our children.
sentences.cn: 我们想跟孩子们一起制作硫酸铜晶体。

sentences.en: You’ve really grown since I last saw you.
sentences.cn: 你比我上次见到时长了不少啊。

words.tran_cn: 长大的；成年的；长满某物的
生长；变成；栽培（grow的过去分词）

phrases.tran_cn: 逐渐适应：发展或变化以适应
渐渐喜爱：逐渐变得令人愉快或使人接受
(非正式)（好像长在树上似的）伸手即可得到，极易得到
产生自…：由…而发展或形成
一起成长，共同成长；长在一起；长合，愈合；混合

trans.tran_cn: 生长，栽种，变长，成长，变得，增加，发展，壮大，提升品质
trans.tran_en: to become bigger, taller etc over a period of time in the process of becoming an adult
